@@ -337,6 +337,9 @@
 /* Always define this */
 #undef _XOPEN_SOURCE
 
+/* Always define this */
+#undef _GNU_SOURCE
+
 /* Define if you have a working <inttypes.h> header file. */
 #undef HAVE_INTTYPES_H

   --help                  print this message

+  --site-file=FILE        use FILE as the site file
   --version               print the version of autoconf that created configure
 Directory and file names:
   --prefix=PREFIX         install architecture-independent files in PREFIX
@@ -386,6 +388,11 @@ EOF
   -site=* | --site=* | --sit=*)
     site="$ac_optarg" ;;
 
+  -site-file | --site-file | --site-fil | --site-fi | --site-f)
+    ac_prev=sitefile ;;
+  -site-file=* | --site-file=* | --site-fil=* | --site-fi=* | --site-f=*)
+    sitefile="$ac_optarg" ;;
+
   -srcdir | --srcdir | --srcdi | --srcd | --src | --sr)
     ac_prev=srcdir ;;
   -srcdir=* | --srcdir=* | --srcdi=* | --srcd=* | --src=* | --sr=*)
@@ -551,12 +558,16 @@ fi
 srcdir=`echo "${srcdir}" | sed 's%\([^/]\)/*$%\1%'`
 
 # Prefer explicitly selected file to automatically selected ones.
-if test -z "$CONFIG_SITE"; then
-  if test "x$prefix" != xNONE; then
-    CONFIG_SITE="$prefix/share/config.site $prefix/etc/config.site"
-  else
-    CONFIG_SITE="$ac_default_prefix/share/config.site $ac_default_prefix/etc/config.site"
+if test -z "$sitefile"; then
+  if test -z "$CONFIG_SITE"; then
+    if test "x$prefix" != xNONE; then
+      CONFIG_SITE="$prefix/share/config.site $prefix/etc/config.site"
+    else
+      CONFIG_SITE="$ac_default_prefix/share/config.site $ac_default_prefix/etc/config.site"
+    fi
   fi
+else
+  CONFIG_SITE="$sitefile"
 fi
 for ac_site_file in $CONFIG_SITE; do
   if test -r "$ac_site_file"; then
@@ -611,7 +622,7 @@ copy=cp
 # - two terminals occur directly after each other
 # - the path contains an element with a dot in it
 echo $ac_n "checking LIBRARY_PATH variable""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:615: checking LIBRARY_PATH variable" >&5
+echo "configure:626: checking LIBRARY_PATH variable" >&5
 case ${LIBRARY_PATH} in
   [:\;]* | *[:\;] | *[:\;][:\;]* |  *[:\;]. | .[:\;]*| . | *[:\;].[:\;]* )
     library_path_setting="contains current directory"
@@ -636,7 +647,7 @@ fi
 # - two terminals occur directly after each other
 # - the path contains an element with a dot in it
 echo $ac_n "checking GCC_EXEC_PREFIX variable""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:640: checking GCC_EXEC_PREFIX variable" >&5

     gcc_exec_prefix_setting="contains current directory"
@@ -994,7 +1005,7 @@ else { echo "configure: error: can not run $ac_config_sub" 1>&2; exit 1; }

-echo "configure:1019: checking target system type" >&5
+echo "configure:1030: checking target system type" >&5

@@ -1033,7 +1044,7 @@ target_os=`echo $target | sed 's/^\([^-]*\)-\([^-]*\)-\(.*\)$/\3/'`

+echo "configure:1048: checking build system type" >&5

@@ -1141,7 +1152,7 @@ fi
       # Extract the first word of "cl", so it can be a program name with args.

+echo "configure:1188: checking whether the C compiler ($CC $CFLAGS $LDFLAGS) works" >&5

@@ -1184,12 +1195,12 @@ cross_compiling=$ac_cv_prog_cc_cross
 
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext << EOF

   ac_cv_prog_cc_works=yes

   if (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null; then
@@ -1215,12 +1226,12 @@ if test $ac_cv_prog_cc_works = no; then
   { echo "configure: error: installation or configuration problem: C compiler cannot create executables." 1>&2; exit 1; }

-echo "configure:1224: checking whether we are using GNU C" >&5
+echo "configure:1235: checking whether we are using GNU C" >&5

 else
@@ -1229,7 +1240,7 @@ else

 #endif

+if { ac_try='${CC-cc} -E conftest.c'; { (eval echo configure:1244: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }; } | egrep yes >/dev/null 2>&1; then

@@ -1296,16 +1307,16 @@ else

-if { (eval echo configure:1300: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; } &&
-   test -f conftest.o && { (eval echo configure:1301: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; };

-    if { ac_try='cc -c conftest.c 1>&5'; { (eval echo configure:1306: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }; }; then

-      if { (eval echo configure:1308: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; } &&
-	 test -f conftest.o && { (eval echo configure:1309: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; };
+      if { (eval echo configure:1319: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; } &&
+	 test -f conftest.o && { (eval echo configure:1320: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; };
       then
         # cc works too.
         :

@@ -1355,7 +1366,7 @@ long double foo = 0.0;

 ; return 0; }
